definition: two-faced person/double-dealing
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: I knew that I am a genuine double-dealer.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，我纔是一個真正的兩面派。

sentences.english: The die-hards of today are precisely such double-dealers.
sentences.chinese: 現在的頑固分子，就是這種兩面派。

sentences.english: Mrs Reding said Paris had been duplicitous in its dealings with the European authorities.
sentences.chinese: 瑞丁女士稱法國在此事的處理上對歐盟大搞兩面派。

sentences.english: And so the game of deceit and double-dealing continued.
sentences.chinese: 因此這個欺騙和兩面派的遊戲繼續進行了下去。
欺騙性的或兩面派的手法。

sentences.english: We make a distinction between such people with a dual character and the traitors and pro-Japanese elements.
sentences.chinese: 將這種兩面派分子，和漢奸親日派加以區別。

sentences.english: Two-faced people are usually back stabbers.
sentences.chinese: 兩面派也通常都會在別人背後下刀子。

sentences.english: "You say I did a volte-face, but we are going back many years now, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “你會說我是兩面派，但我們早已走上正軌，”他說。

sentences.english: How do counter-revolutionaries employ their double-dealing tactics?
sentences.chinese: 反革命分子怎樣耍兩面派手法呢？

sentences.english: Double-dealers will come to no good end.
sentences.chinese: 耍兩面派終歸不會有好下場。

definition: a spy/a crafty person
protective coloration/camouflage
irrelevant/beside the point
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to get straight to the point (idiom)
to make a fool of oneself
loudhailer/megaphone/one who parrots sb/mouthpiece
(slang) (Tw) to bullshit/to fool
to boast
equivocal/ambiguous
obscene language
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
to go around in circles/to make a detour/(fig.) to beat about the bush
white face/face painting in Beijing opera etc
villains collude together (idiom); to work hand in glove with sb (to nefarious ends)
an American (derog.)/a Yankee
